title: Hacks I Use for Managing a Chronic Migraine Episode

content: As we all know by now, I've suffered from chronic migraine episodes since I was a teenager. So, without dwelling on how debilitating these attacks can be, I wanted to highlight a few hacks currently in my self-care plan.

Take advantage of the hot and cold sensations your body reacts to (hot water, cold water, ice packs, heating pads, etc.). I usually run a hot bath about 6 inches deep. I place my hands and feet completely under the hot water. At the same time, I place an ice pack on the back of my neck.
Here’s another hack: I wrap my hair up tightly in a towel turban. It seems to help alleviate some of my head pressure.
You must stay hydrated. I always have something like Gatorade, green and ginger tea, fruit Popsicles, and Pedialyte on hand.
For pure pain, I've found that "tricks" like pinching the web between the thumb and index finger help temporarily.
My other go-to trick is mentally searching for the exact source of the pain.

content: It's sort of like meditatively concentrating on the actual area that seems to hurt (say, behind the eyes), but the place is physically fine, so it doesn't hurt.
The pain goes away as long as you maintain concentration. If you can do this, it's great for situations where you have to be present but don't have to pay too much attention.
Placing safely diluted peppermint oil on the temples, on my wrists, under my nose, and on the back of my neck can work wonders.
If I'm experiencing auras , sitting up eases my pain considerably.
Taking a daily dose of magnesium helps prevent and balance my episodes.
Brace yourself for my next migraine hack: Take a big ol’ swig of pickle juice. The shock to my tastebuds distracts my brain enough so that part of the pain dissipates for a moment.

Take black tights or stockings and tie them around your head as a blindfold. For me, it works better than a sleep mask because it puts the perfect amount of gentle pressure on my eyes, keeps them firmly closed, and lets the tight muscles around them relax against the pressure.

content: Also, never underestimate the power of blackout curtains. If you can't get to a store, here's a trick: Wipe your window with a wet washcloth, and then tinfoil will stick flat onto the glass and block out the light. You can thank me later.

Forgiveness. Giving myself grace is one of my most essential hacks. I secretly beat myself up for far too long for not allowing myself to rest. I now understand it’s not my fault if I can’t achieve everything I had hoped to do that day for myself and others.

Finally, take the time to get to know you. What makes you feel great and what doesn't? Journal , observe, and note what aligns with you and what doesn't. Once you know your triggers, you can remove them from your life.
So, there are my supportive migraine hacks. Do you use any of these? Do you have any to share?
